All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AllowanceType
The AllowanceType enumeration allows expanding the traditional boolean logic to also include an "If Necessary" type.
Assessor
The assessor node contains properties for setting the name and role of the assessor It should always only use either name or first + lastname, but never both Role should never be supplied without having set up the name properly
Assessor
The Assessor class represents an assessor of the user's document.
Assessors
The assessors node groups together all assessors specified by the user.
AST
The AST represents Pipp's Abstract Syntax Tree (AST).
Author
The author node represents an author of the document
Author
Represents the author of a type of work represented by a first and last name.
Authors
The authors node groups together all authors specified by the user
Book
A Book is a traditional type of work, which is usually referenced using its title, author(s), and publication details (usually the publisher and publication date).
Citation
The citation node represents a citation, which needs to have a source, the cited content, and some form of numeration (for example, the page number).
CitedText
A cited text node either contains a citation or a text.
Configuration
The configuration node groups together all configurations
ConfigurationException
 
DocumentMetaDataWriter
 
DocumentType
The DocumentType enumeration declares the allowed document types that a document can have.
Endnotes
The endnotes node represents the endnotes style configuration
Font
 
FrontEndBridge
 
HeaderStamp
 
IllegalConfigurationException
 
InconsistencyWarning
 
IncorrectFormatException
 
Layout
The layout node determines the general layout properties of the document
LineFactory
 
Main
 
MissingConfigurationException
 
MissingMemberException
 
MissingMemberWarning
 
MLA9
 
Music
 
NoArgumentStructure
The no argument structure node contains a structure, which receives no arguments.
Node
The Node class represents a node in Pipp's Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) Nodes have to extend from this class and are forced to check for warnings and errors
Numeration
The numeration node contains information about how the page numbers should be styled
NumerationAuthorName
 
NumerationPosition
The numeration position class determines where the page numbers are located
NumerationType
The numeration type class determines in which numeration system the numbers are displayed.
PageAssembler
 
PageFactory
 
PageNumberStamp
 
Paragraph
The paragraph node represents the structural paragraph style configuration
Parser
The Parser class is responsible for creating a syntax tree for the Pipp document.
PDFCreator
 
Periodical
 
Pipp
 
PippException
 
Poem
 
Processor
The processor class translates the AST given by the Parser to actual objects that can be used when creating the document TODO: Publication TODO: Title
Publication
The publication node represents the publication configuration
Publication
Specifies information about the publication of a work The most essential information are the publication name (for example, the name of the publisher of a book), the date (for example, the year it was published), the location (for example, in which country it has been published), and roles of other people than the author (for example, editors, directors, screenwriters, etc.)
Role
Represents a role of a person having worked on a work other than the author
Scanner
Responsible for the lexical analysis of .pipp files Uses DFAs to convert the input into a set of tokens
Sentence
 
Structure
The structure node groups together the structure configuration
StructureType
The StructureType enumeration declares all structural keywords that can be used in Pipp.
Style
The style node contains information about how the document should be styled.
StyleGuide
Defines traits and rules that a formal style guide uses.
StyleTable
The style table is responsible for resolving the name of a style guide to its actual StyleGuide object.
Title
The title node contains the title of the document
Token
 
TokenType
 
UnlikelinessWarning
 
VideoGame
 
Warning
 
WarningQueue
 
WarningSeverity
 
WebPage
 
WhitespaceAllowanceType
The Whitespace Allowance Type determines whether the user is allowed to use whitespace characters in sentences or if it should be automatically removed.
Work
A work represents any kind of work done by someone other than the author, which needs to be referenced.
